DLGxY5h2.title: Synthesis and Crystal Structure of (PzCH 2 CHOHCH 2 PzH)·(Ph 2 SnCl 3 ) (Pz = 3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)
DLGxY5h2.abstract:
Abstract  Reaction of Ph2SnCl2 with 1,3-bis(3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)-2-propanol (L) in a 1:1 ratio yields L(SnPh2Cl2)2 adduct, which partly hydrolyzes to the title complex (C25H31Cl3N4OSn, Mr = 628.58) during crystal growing in the air. The title complex is of monoclinic, space group P21/n with a = 9.0338(9), b = 17.890(1), c = 17.340(1) Å, β = 95.533(1)o, V = 2798.9(5) Å3, Z = 4, Dc = 1.492 Mg/m3, λ(MoKα) = 0.71073 Å, μ = 1.224 mm−1, F(000) = 1272, R = 0.023, wR = 0.054 for 4212 observed reflections with I ≥ 2σ(I). The crystal structure indicates that there is no direct interaction between the pyrazolyl ligand and the tin atom, but
 this complex forms a supramolecular structure through weak intermolecular C–H⋯Cl and O–H⋯Cl hydrogen bonds.
 
 
 
 
 Graphical Abstract  Reaction of Ph2SnCl2 with 1,3-bis(3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)-2-propanol (L) in a 1:1 ratio yields L(SnPh2Cl2)2 adduct, which partly hydrolyzes to (PzCH2CHOHCH2PzH)·(Ph2SnCl3) (Pz = 3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl) during crystal growing in the air.

ljYvFvCf.title: Coordination assembly of znII/cdII terephthalate with bis-pyridinecarboxamide tectons: Establishing net entanglements from [3 ± 3] interpenetration to high-connected self-penetration
ljYvFvCf.abstract: Four polymeric d10 metal terephthalate complexes incorporating bis-pyridinecarboxamide building blocks were prepared to explore the effect of the central metal ion or the fluorine substituent of the ligand on the topology and entanglement of coordination networks. The combination of ZnII terephthalate with a fluorinated ligand leads to a noninterpenetrated coordination layer with honeycomb (hcb) topology for complex 1. Interestingly, the other three materials display the unusual entangling coordination networks. For 2, the reaction of zinc terephthalate with nonfluorinated ligand affords three-dimensional diamond (dia) architecture of [3 + 3] interpenetration, while the CdII terephthalate complexes 3 and 4 with the two types of bis-pyridinecarboxamide tectons show the isostructural self-penetrating framework with unique 8-connected (417.611) topology. © 2013 American Chemical Society.

v99iKNPL.title: Porous coordination networks generated from lanthanum trifluoromethanesulfonate and single/mixed N-oxide spacer linkers
v99iKNPL.abstract: Three new lanthanum coordination polymers {[La(μ-L) 2 L(H 2 O) 2 ](CF 3 SO 3 ) 3 } n ( 1 ), {[La(μ-L ′ )(CF 3 SO 3 )(H 2 O) 2 (μ-L) 0.5 L](H 2 O) 3 (CF 3 SO 3 )} n ( 2 ) and {[La(μ-L ′ ) 2 (μ-L)](H 2 O) 1.5 (CF 3 SO 3 )} n ( 3 ) have been prepared by the reaction of La(CF 3 SO 3 ) 3 with 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane- N , N ′ -dioxide (L), or with mixed N-oxide ligands L and L ′ (HL ′ =isonicotinic acid N-oxide) in different molar ratios. Single-crystal X-ray analysis showed that 1 possesses a three-dimensional coordination framework connected by L ligands, whereas bridging by both L and L ′ spacers in different molar ratios results in coordination polymers 2 and 3 that exhibit two- and three-dimensional networks, respectively. Compounds 2 and 3 represent the first metal complexes containing two different N-oxide bridging ligands. Thermogravimetric analysis studies revealed that ligands L and L ′ are bound differently in compounds 1 – 3 due to their distinctive coordination modes.

lfJw2mcR.title: [1,5-Bis(1-methyl-1H-imidazol-2-ylmethyl-κN3)-1, 5-diazacyclooctane-N,N′]chlorocobalt(II) perchlorate
lfJw2mcR.abstract: The crystal structure of the title compound, [CoCl-(C16H26N6)]ClO4, consists of discrete [CoCl(C16H26N6)]+ cations and perchlorate anions. The five-coordinate CoII atom has four nitrogen donors from the new mesocyclic ligand 1,5-bis(1-methyl-1H-imidazol-2-ylmethyl)-1,5-diazacyclooctane [Co-N 2.046 (3)-2.214 (4) angstrom], and a chloride anion at the apical site [Co-Cl 2.3184 (13) angstrom]. The coordination geometry of the complex is essentially square pyramidal. The mesocyclic ligand takes a boat-chair configuration and the two imidazole pendants are not coplanar. The dihedral angle between the two imidazole planes is 15.97°. An H atom from the 1,5-diazacyclooctane group effectively blocks the axial coordination site opposite the Cl ligand.

9B3JkvbN.title: Synthesis, spectra and crystal structure of a CuII complex exhibiting novel two-dimensional joint-ladder like hydrogen-bonding pattern with an amino-acid type diazamesocyclic ligand
9B3JkvbN.abstract: The mononuclear Cu II complex [Cu L (H 2 O)]·2H 2 O ( 1 ) with a diazamesocyclic ligand bearing two functional carboxylic donor groups, 1,5-diazacyclooctane- N , N ′-diacetate acid ( H 2 L ), has been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, thermal analyses and IR spectrum. The crystal structure of 1 has been determined by X-ray diffraction analysis, which revealed that the Cu II center coordinates to the tetradentate chelated ligand L and an axial water molecule, and the 1,5-diazacyclooctane (DACO) moiety adopts a boat / chair conformation that inhibits the axial coordination at the metal center to form this penta-coordinated pyramidal (CuN 2 O 3 ) complex. The most striking feature of this structure is the formation of a novel two-dimensional joint-ladder like architecture through multiple inter- and intramolecular O–H⋯O hydrogen bonds. The solution behaviors of 1 have been further investigated by conductance, UV–Vis and ESR techniques.

M3bjrVVx.title: Three-dimensional (3-D) metal-organic frameworks with 3-pyridin-4-yl-benzoate defining new (3,6)-connected net topologies
M3bjrVVx.abstract: Reactions of different metal salts with 3-pyridin-4-yl-benzoic acid (3,4-Hpybz) under ambient condition afford a series of 3-D metal-organic frameworks with two new types of (3,6)-connected net topologies. In the isomorphic complexes [M2(μ-H2O)(3,4-pybz)4]n (MII=MnII for 1, ZnII for 2, or CdII for 3), the octahedral metal nodes are extended by the 3-connected pybz tectons to constitute 3-D arrays with the Schläfli symbol of (3.4.5)(32.44.55.62.72), whereas [Pb(3,4-pybz)2]n (4) shows a completely different 3-D (42.6)2(44.62.89) framework, which represents a subnet of the (4,8)-connected fluorite lattice. © 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

9kxftI5J.title: A hydrogen-bonded 3D coordination network of CuII nitrate with pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid and 3-(2-pyridyl)pyrazole: hydrothermal synthesis, characterization and crystal structure
9kxftI5J.abstract: A pentacoordinate monomeric Cu II complex, [Cu(H 2 O)(H L 1 )( L 2 )](NO 3 )(H 2 O) ( 1 ), with the mixed ligands (where H 2 L 1 =pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylic acid and L 2 =3-(2-pyridyl)pyrazole), has been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, IR, thermogravimetric analysis and X-ray diffraction techniques. X-ray structural analysis of complex 1 revealed that the Cu II center has a CuN 3 O 2 distorted square pyramid environment with three N atoms of two different ligands and an O atom of coordinated water molecule constituting the mean plane, and one O atom of ligand H L 1 occupying the axial site. The H 2 L 1 ligand is mono-deprotonated in this structure, and only one oxygen atom of the carboxylate group coordinates to the Cu II center. A striking structural feature of complex 1 is the three-dimensional supramolecular architecture formed through intermolecular C–H⋯O, O–H⋯O and N–H⋯O hydrogen-bonding interactions. The IR and ESR spectra, and thermogravimetric analysis of complex 1 have been further investigated.

XcYtat3U.title: Hydrothermal synthesis, characterization and crystal structure of a three-dimensional (3D) ZnII supramolecular compound with ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid ligand and 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium guests
XcYtat3U.abstract: A new supramolecular compound [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)](Q) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ( 1 ), where H 4 EDTA=ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid and Q=4-(carboxylate)pyridinium, has been prepared by mild hydrothermal reaction and characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectrum and thermogravimetric analysis. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction of 1 [monoclinic, space group C2 / c , a =11.310(4) Å, b =9.704(4) Å, c =23.798(10) Å, β =97.401(10)°, Z =4] revealed that the Zn II ion coordinates to the chelating tetradentate ligand H 2 EDTA and a water molecule, taking a distorted trigonal-bipyramid geometry. The mononuclear [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] subunits are linked to form two-dimensional layered architectures by the lattice water moieties through O–H⋯O hydrogen bonds, which are further extended to a three-dimensional (3D) supramolecular network by 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium guests (resulting from the ring-opening hydrolysis of 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole) through extensive hydrogen-bonding interactions. The 3D supramolecular framework is also stabilized by significant face-to-face π–π stacking interactions between the aromatic pyridinium systems. Keywords Hydrothermal synthesis Crystal structure Hydrogen-bonding interaction Aromatic stacking Supramolecular compound 1 Introduction The rapid development in crystal engineering of metal-involved supramolecular architectures assembled by means of coordination bonds, hydrogen bonds or other weak intermolecular interactions continues to produce various structures with interesting compositions and topologies, along with potential applications as a new class of functional solid materials [1–8] . Meanwhile, the preparation of various supramolecular compounds helps to obtain new information of intermolecular interactions, which is apparently important for rational design and construction of desired architectures. Currently, a lot of researchers are focusing their attention on the crystal engineering of supramolecular architectures organized by coordination covalent bonds or hydrogen bonds and π–π stacking interactions [1–8] . In particular, the hydrogen-bonding interaction has attracted most interest due to its relative strength and directional properties [9] in generating a great variety of one-, two-, and three-dimensional either non-interpenerating open networks with variable cavities or channels of desired sizes [10,11] or well-entangled structures through interpeneration [12,13] . Proper selection of metal ions and ligands with suitable functionalized groups is the key issue in designing and self-assembling of coordination supramolecules equipped with peripheral hydrogen-bonding subunits [11] . Amongst the synthetic strategies in the context of coordination chemistry, one of the most fruitful choices is taking advantage of ligand molecule such as ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (H 4 EDTA), which possess diverse functional groups and could give more possibility to form hydrogen bonds. Meanwhile, Zn 2+ ion could easily coordinates with carboxylic O and pyridyl N donor groups. Moreover, the coordination chemistry of oxadiazole-containing dipyridyl ligands, such as 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole ( L 1 ) and 2,5-bis(3-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole ( L 2 ), have been of our recent research interests for their unique versatile bonding-modes and strong capability of forming hydrogen-bonding interactions [14–20] . Thus, we anticipate that the incorporation of both interesting organic subunits would lead to fascinating coordination supramolecules upon metal complexation. To our surprise, a novel hydrogen-bonding supramolecular compound [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)](Q) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ( 1 ) was obtained under mild hydrothermal condition, in which Zn II ion is chelated to H 2 EDTA (as an anionic ligand) and the hydrolysis of L 1 leads to the opening of the central oxadiazole ring to give 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium (Q) during this course. 2 Experimental 2.1 Materials and general methods With the exception of the bridging ligand 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole ( L 1 ), which was synthesized according to reported literature procedure [21] , all of the starting materials and solvents for syntheses and analyses were obtained commercially and used as received. FT-IR spectra (KBr pellets) were taken on an AVATAR-370 (Nicolet) spectrometer and carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen analyses were performed on a CE-440 (Leemanlabs) analyzer. Thermal stability analysis (TGA) experiment was carried out on a Dupont thermal analyzer from room temperature to 800 °C under nitrogen atmosphere at a heating rate of 10 °C min −1 . 2.2 Synthesis of complex 1 An aqueous solution (10 ml) containing Zn(NO 3 ) 2 ·6H 2 O (29.8 mg, 0.1 mmol), L 1 (22.4 mg, 0.1 mmol) and H 4 EDTA (29.2 mg, 0.1 mmol) was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (20 ml) under autogenous pressure, which was heated to 145 °C for 72 h, and then cooled to room temperature at the rate of 5 °C h −1 . Colorless rhombus-like crystalline products were collected in 43% yield. Found: C, 40.43; H, 4.25; N, 8.47%. Calc. for C 22 H 30 N 4 O 15 Zn: C, 40.29; H, 4.61; N, 8.54%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm −1 ): 3396b, 3107m, 3091m, 3068m, 2940m, 2902w, 2563w, 2170m, 1979w, 1647vs, 1516w, 1496m, 1455m, 1419s, 1393m, 1345s, 1291s, 1259s, 1193m, 1128w, 1107m, 1081w, 1060w, 1044m, 986s, 966m, 923m, 868s, 811s, 771s, 737m, 689s, 647m, 577m. 2.3 Crystallographic data collection and structure determination Single-crystal X-ray diffraction study of complex 1 was performed on a BRUKER SMART 1000 CCD diffractometer equipped with a graphite crystal monochromator situated in the incident beam for data collection. The determination of unit cell parameters and data collections (in the range of 2.78< θ <25.08°) were performed with Mo Kα radiation ( λ =0.71073 Å) by ϖ scan mode at 293(2) K. All data were corrected by semi-empirical method using sadabs program. The program saint [22] was used for integration of the diffraction profiles. The structure was solved by direct methods using shelxs program of the shelxl -97 package and refined with shelxl [23] . Zn II center was located from the E -map and other non-hydrogen atoms were located in successive difference Fourier syntheses. The final refinements were performed by full matrix least-squares methods with anisotropic thermal parameters for non-hydrogen atoms on F 2 . All the hydrogen atoms were first found in difference electron density maps, and then placed in the calculated sites and included in the final refinement in the riding model approximation with displacement parameters derived from the parent atoms to which they were bonded. The ratio of minimum to maximum apparent transmission is 0.8400. Molecular graphics were drawn with the program package diamond (Version 2.1c) [24] . Further crystallographic data and experimental details for structural analysis are summarized in Table 1 , and positional parameters and atomic coordinates are listed in Table 2 . 3 Results and discussion 3.1 Description of the crystal structure of complex 1 The molecular and supramolecular structure of compound 1 was revealed by an X-ray single-crystal structure determination. Each independent crystallographic unit contains half [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] neutral subunit, one 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium molecule and one lattice water, as shown in Fig. 1 . For the [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] coordinated moiety, Zn(1) and O(5) atoms are located in the special sites with 0.5 occupancy and the H 2 EDTA ligand is related by a C 2 axis through Zn(1)–O(5). The Zn II center is chelated by two nitrogen atoms [Zn(1)–N(1)=2.215(3) Å] and two oxygen donors from two carboxylate groups [Zn(1)–O(3)=2.063(3) Å] of the tetradentate H 2 EDTA ligand, and one additional water molecule [Zn(1)–O(4)=2.048 Å]. Thus, the coordination polyhedron for Zn II could be best described as a distorted trigonal-bipyramid with the τ value of 0.65, which is defined by Addison et al. [25] to describe the degree of distortion for the coordination environment of penta-coordinated complex ( τ =1 for an ideal trigonal-bipyramid and τ =0 for an ideal square-pyramid). Two carboxylate O(3) and O(3A) atoms act as the axis with the O–Zn–O angle of 178.42(15)°, and the other three coordinated donors consist of the basal plane (Zn II ion is completely located in this coordination plane due to the symmetry). It should be noted that although only two carboxylic groups of H 2 EDTA are deprotonated and coordinate to the Zn II center, weak interactions between Zn II and the other two carboxylic groups are also observed with Zn(1)–O(1) distance of 2.588(4) Å. Selected bond lengths and angles for 1 are listed in Table 3 . For carboxylic groups in H 2 EDTA, the C(3)–O(2) length [1.289(4) Å] is significantly longer than that of C(3)–O(1) [1.214(4) Å], and for the carboxylate group, the coordinated C(5)–O(3) bond length [1.262(4) Å] is longer than that of the uncoordinated C(5)–O(4) bond [1.239(4) Å], agreeing with their structural features. For the guest molecule 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium in the lattice, one hydrogen atom is located on the pyridine nitrogen group, which was determined according to the comparison of the final refinement results. Additionally, two C–O bond distances of the carboxylate group are almost equivalent [1.242(4) vs. 1.254(5) Å], which further confirms this conclusion. Analysis of the crystal packing of complex 1 in the unit cell shows that there exist multiple hydrogen-bonding interactions, resulting in a novel three-dimensional (3D) supramolecular network. All the relevant hydrogen-bonding values and the symmetry codes are listed in Table 4 . As shown in Fig. 2 , each coordinated water molecule in [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] forms a pair of intramolecular O(5)–H(5A)⋯O(8) bonds with two adjacent lattice water molecules. Meanwhile, each lattice water also form an intermolecular O(8)–H(8A)⋯O(4) i ( i = x −1/2, y −1/2, z ) interaction with the uncoordinated carboxylate oxygen atom of the neighboring [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] subunit. Thus, the lattice water molecules connect the mononuclear subunits through two types of O–H⋯O hydrogen bonds to form a 2D layered structure along (110) plane (see Fig. 2 ). The resulting motif of the closed repeating unit of this 2D structure, in the formalism of graph-set analysis of hydrogen-bond patterns [26] , is characterized as N 8 = R 8 8 (30). Further analysis of the packing mode of these 2D layers indicates that they adopt the anti-parallel packing along [001] direction (see Fig. 3 ) . The 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium guest moieties are inside in the space among these 2D layers, as shown in Fig. 3 . Each lattice water molecule and [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] subunit in the 2D layer also forms the intermolecular O(8)–H(8B)⋯O(6) i and O(2)–H(2)⋯O(7) ii bonds, respectively, with two oxygen atoms of the carboxylate group of 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium. Meantime, the carboxylate oxygen atoms of [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)] act as the acceptors in the N(2)–H(2C)⋯O(4) iii and N(2)–H(2C)⋯O(3) iii hydrogen bonds with the the N–H active group in 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium. Thus, these 2D layers are further linked into an interesting sawtooth-like 3D supramolecular architecture by 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium molecules through O–H⋯O and N–H⋯O hydrogen-bonding interactions. For all the hydrogen bonds stated above, the bond geometries are in the normal range for such weak interactions [27] . Additionally, the closest approach between two adjacent parallel 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium molecules is only 3.22 Å with a center-to-center distance of 3.50 Å, indicating significant face-to-face π–π stacking interaction [28] , which further stabilizes this 3D supramolecular system. Examination of this structure with PLATON [29] showed that there were no solvent-accessible voids in the crystal lattice of 1 . 3.2 Preparation, IR and TG analysis of compound 1 The structure determination of 1 indicates that during the hydrothermal reaction process, 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium was obtained from the hydrolysis of 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole. Similar case was also observed when Zn(NO 3 ) 2 was replaced by Cu(NO 3 ) 2 in the reaction course, and a known complex [Cu(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ]·2H 2 O (L=isonicotinic acid) was obtained [30] . In the IR spectrum of the title complex 1 , the absorption bands resulting from the skeletal vibrations of the aromatic rings appear in the 1400–1600 cm −1 region. The broad band centered at ca. 3400 cm −1 indicates the O–H stretching of the carboxylic group and/or coordinated/lattice water molecules. There are two sharp bands with medium intensity at ca. 3100 cm −1 , which are due to the N–H stretching of the protonated pyridine ring. A very strong peak at 1647 cm −1 is attributed to the anti-symmetric stretching vibration, and the strong peak at 1345 cm −1 to the symmetric vibration of the carboxylic/carboxylate groups. Additionally, asymmetric and symmetric stretching of CH 2 - groups of H 2 EDTA occurs at about 2900 cm −1 [31] . Thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) were conducted to determine the thermal stability of complex 1 . The first weight loss of 8.58% from 80 to 170 °C (peak: 145 °C) corresponds to the loss of two lattice water molecules and one coordinated water molecule (calculated: 8.23%). The remaining substance does not lose weight upon further heating until two continuous weight loss occur in 190–305 °C region (peaks: 248 and 265 °C), corresponding to the removal of two 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium guests (observed: 37.28%, calculated: 37.54%). Further heating to 800 °C of the sample indicates a continuous and slow weight loss. 4 Conclusion and comments In conclusion, the title supramolecular compound [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)](Q) 2 (H 2 O) 2 1 can be assembled by means of the hydrothermal synthesis of Zn II salt, ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (H 4 EDTA) and 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole. The structure determination reveals that the guest 4-(carboxylate)pyridinium molecules, resulting from the ring-opening hydrolysis of 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole, expand the [Zn(H 2 EDTA)(H 2 O)](H 2 O) 2 subunits with 2D hydrogen-bonding layered motif to form a final 3D host–guest supramolecular network through extensive hydrogen-bonding interactions, which is also stabilized by significant π–π stacking interactions between the pyridinium rings. It would provide interesting experimental data for supramolecular chemistry and crystal engineering. 5 Supplementary materials Crystallographic data for the crystal structure reported in this paper have been deposited with the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Center (CCDC No. 235495). This material can be obtained free of charge via www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/conts/retrieving.html (or from the CCDC, 12 Union Road, Cambridge CB2 1EZ, UK; fax: +44-1223-336033; e-mail: deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk ). RC3i3ySa.title: Co-crystallization of hemimellitic acid with 4,4'-bipyridine forming a pillar-layered hydrogen-bonded network.
RC3i3ySa.abstract: Co-crystallization of hemimellitic acid (benzene-1,2,3-tricarboxylic acid) dihydrate (H3HMA.2H2O) with 4,4'-bipyridine (4,4'-bpy) affords the 1:1 co-crystal benzene-1,2,3-tricarboxylic acid-4,4'-bipyridine (1/1), H3HMA.4,4'-bpy or C9H6O6.C10H8N2. Strong O-H...O hydrogen bonds connect the acid molecules to form a one-dimensional zigzag chain, around which the 4,4'-bpy components are fixed as arms via O-H...N interactions, resulting in a ladder motif. Through weak C-H...O non-covalent forces, the resulting acid layers are extended into a three-dimensional pillar-layered architecture supported by rod-like 4,4'-bpy components. The influence on hydrogen-bonding models is also discussed, with the discovery of an unexpected interaction motif that does not follow the routine hydrogen-bonded hierarchical rule in the construction of an acid-base co-crystal.
RC3i3ySa.venue: Acta crystallographica. Section C, Crystal structure communications

pPadcRCh.title: Fluorine-induced chiral coordination arrays containing helical hydrogen-bonding chains of water or fluorinated ligand
pPadcRCh.abstract: Two chiral d10 metallosupramolecular systems based on an achiral fluorinated Schiff-base ligand have been prepared and characterized. The ZnII complex 1 reveals 21 helical coordination chains with the inclusion of rare water chains of opposite helix in the perpendicular channels, whereas the CdII complex 2 displays the homochiral 1D coordination motifs with 31 symmetry and a 3D supramolecular architecture built by C-H•••F interactions. © 2011 American Chemical Society.

QDlN9GNG.title: Interplay of coordinative and supramolecular interactions in engineering unusual crystalline architectures of low-dimensional metal–pamoate complexes under co-ligand intervention
QDlN9GNG.abstract: This work presents a systematic investigation on coordination chemistry of a pharmaceutical agent pamoic acid (H2PA), and also reveals the significant function of supramolecular interactions in managing the resultant crystalline networks with the incorporation of secondary co-ligands. Assemblies of pamoic acid with transition metal ions under similar conditions yield a series of eleven Mn II ,C u II ,Z n II , and Cd II complexes, in the absence/presence of the organonitrogen ligands such as 2,29-bipyridyl (2,29-bipy), 1,10-phenanthroline (phen), and 4,49-bipyridyl (4,49-bipy). These compounds, together with the DMF solvate of pamoic acid, have been characterized by IR, elemental analysis, and single-crystal X-ray diffraction techniques. Generally, these complexes display similar 1-D pamoate-bridged coordination arrays (or 2-D coordination layers by introducing bridging 4,49-bipy). Remarkably, distinct extended network architectures are further constructed with the aid of weak secondary interactions especially aromatic stacking. Amongst them, complexes 6, 8, 9, and 12, which exhibit unusual interpenetrating networks of (6,3) layers or 3-D 5-connected frameworks regulated by stacking forces, are representative paradigms of this research. Structural evolution under the co-ligand intervention in this series of complexes, as well as the general coordination rule of pamoate, has been further discussed. Thermal stability of these crystalline materials and fluorescent properties of the polymeric Zn II and Cd II complexes have also been explored.

vMF4c3EX.title: Kinetics and Mechanism of Catalytic Hydrolysis of 4-Nitrophenyl Acetate Ester by Cu(Ⅱ) Complex of 1,10-Phenanthroline Derivative as a Mimic Enzyme
vMF4c3EX.abstract: The kinetics of copper(II) complex of 1,10 phenanthroline derivative ligand as catalysts to undergo hydrolysis of 4-nitrophenyl acetate(NA) ester has been examined.The ligand forms a copper(Ⅱ) complex in the pH range of 7.4-9.2.In the kinetic studies,the hydrolysis results of the copper complex in 10%(V/V) CH_3CN at 298 K,I=0.10 mol/dm~3 KNO_3 and pH 7.4-9.2 show that the Cu(Ⅱ)…OH~-serves as a good nucleophile that effectively catalyze NA hydrolysis.The hydrolysis rate follows the law v=k~~T__(obs)=((k~~(ML)__(obs)~T)+k_(OH~-)+k_0+i).The second-order rate constant of CuLH_(-1) is 0.131 mol~(-1)·dm~3·s~(-1)(t=(25.0±0.1) ℃,I=0.10 mol/L KNO_3,0.020 mol/L Tris buffer,10%CH_3CN aqueous solution).The catalytic reaction mechanism is suggested by the experimental results.

d4WRYKxR.title: Diaquabis(2,5-di-3-pyridyl-1,3,4-oxadiazole)dithiocyanatomanganese(II): A three-dimensional supramolecular network formed through O-H⋯N and C-H⋯S interactions
d4WRYKxR.abstract: The molecular structure of the neutral mononuclear title complex, [Mn(NCS) 2(C 12H 8N 4O) 2(H 2O) 2], is centrosymmetric; the Mn II atom lies on an inversion center and is six-coordinate (MnN 4O 2), with an octahedral geometry comprising two trans rnonodentate 2,5-di-3-pyridyl-1,3,4-oxadiazole ligands, two thiocyanate ligands and two bound water molecules. Intermolecular O-H⋯N hydrogen bonds between these monomeric units result in two-dimensional supramolecular layers with a parallel arrangement, which are stabilized by intralayer aromatic stacking and further extended to a three-dimensional network via interlayer weak C-H⋯S interactions. © 2005 International Union of Crystallography Printed in Great Britain - all rights reserved.

n0u1LXQA.title: Controllable assembly of a 3-D metal–organic supramolecular framework with the inclusion of a well-resolved 1-D water morph
n0u1LXQA.abstract: Two mixed-ligand metal–organic complexes [Cd 2 (adipato)(phen) 2 (NO 3 ) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ](H 2 O) 6 ( 1 ) and {[Cd(adipato)(phen)](H 2 O) 3 } n ( 2 ) have been synthesized upon the reaction of Cd(II) nitrate with 1,10-phenanthroline (phen) and adipate under similar conditions. For 1 , the adipato-bridged dinuclear entities are extended into a 3-D supramolecular architecture via hydrogen bonds and π–π stacking. Interestingly, a well-resolved 1-D water morphology consisting of alternate cyclic water tetramer and hexamer is detected as the guests in each channel of this 3-D lattice. Whereas 2 represents a layered coordination polymer in which the Cd II centers are interlinked by adipate dianions via different coordination modes.

ZnKq4zLS.title: Synthesis, spectra and crystal structures of two RuII complexes with polypyridyl ligands: cis-[Ru(bpy)2(4,4′-bpy)Cl](PF6)·H2O and cis-[Ru(phen)2(CH3CN)2](PF6)2
ZnKq4zLS.abstract: Two mononuclear Ru II complexes of polypyridyl ligands, cis -[Ru(bpy) 2 (4,4′-bpy)Cl](PF 6 )·H 2 O ( 1 ) and cis -[Ru(phen) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ](PF 6 ) 2 ( 2 ) (bpy=2,2′-bipyridyl, 4,4′-bpy=4,4′-bipyridyl, and phen=1,10-phenanthroline), have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, IR and UV–vis spectra. The crystal structures of both complexes have been determined by X-ray diffraction, indicating that each Ru II center is hexa-coordinated (RuN 5 Cl for 1 and RuN 6 for 2 ) and takes a distorted octahedral geometry. The favored feature of both complexes is that they are quite useful complex precursors for further constructing new functional architectures.

dZGZJCUs.title: Hierarchical regulated assembly of new metallosupramolecular networks based on metal thiocyanate and trans-1-(2-pyridyl)-2-(4-pyridyl)ethylene (bpe)via multiple interactions
dZGZJCUs.abstract: A series of new polymeric network complexes (M(bpe)2(SCN)2(CH3OH)(H2O)) (M 5 Co II for 1 and Ni II for 2), (Cu(bpe)2(SCN)2(CH3OH))2(Cu(bpe)2(SCN)2 )( 3), (Cu(bpe)2(SCN)2(H2O))22 (Cu(bpe)2(SCN)2 )( 4), (Fe(bpe)2(SCN)2(H2O)2 )( 5) and (Pb(bpe)(SCN)2)n (6) have been designed and prepared from solution assembly of trans-1-(2-pyridyl)-2-(4-pyridyl)ethylene (bpe) and metal thiocyanate at room temperature. X-Ray single-crystal structural determination reveals that the 3-D crystal packing of these complexes is mastered by the interplay of coordinative and secondary non-covalent interactions. The hierarchical regulated strategy in metal-organic supramolecular chemistry is successfully utilized in the rational construction of these architectures, which are, interestingly, influenced by the variation of the concerned assembled elements such as metal ion and solvent medium. The coordination chemistry of thiocyanate ion, especially with Pb II ,i s also summarized.

xurbIMFr.title: CoII and ZnII coordination frameworks with benzene-1,2,3-tricarboxylate tecton and flexible dipyridyl co-ligand: A new type of entangled architecture and a unique 4-connected topological network
xurbIMFr.abstract: Hydrothermal reactions of CoII or ZnII acetate with benzene-1,2,3-tricarboxylic acid (H3bta) and 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpa) afford two unique metal-organic frameworks, in which 1 represents a new type of entangled architecture formed via polycatenane of a pair of (4,4) net with one two-dimensional 3-connected self-interpenetrating pattern, while 2 shows a three-dimensional 4-connected net with a new trinodal topology. © 2011 American Chemical Society.

ENCxGe7H.title: Hydrothermal synthesis, crystal structures, and properties of CoII and NiII supramolecular complexes with 2,4,6-trimethyl benzoate and 4,4′-bipyridyl
ENCxGe7H.abstract: Two new coordination complexes, viz. [Co(tmb) 2 (4,4′-bpy) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ](Htmb) 2 ( 1 ) and {[Ni(tmb) 2 (μ-4,4′-bpy) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ](4,4′-bpy)} n ( 2 ), have been hydrothermally synthesized by reaction of the corresponding metal acetate with 2,4,6-trimethylbenzoic acid (Htmb) and 4,4′-bipyridyl (4,4′-bpy). X-ray single-crystal diffraction suggests that complex 1 represents a discrete mononuclear species in which the central metal ion is coordinated by the terminal carboxylate moiety and the 4,4′-bipyridyl ligand. The crystal structure of complex 2 reveals a 1D chain coordination polymer in which the Ni(II) ions are connected by the bridging 4,4′-bipyridyl ligands. In both cases, the coordination arrays are further extended via hydrogen bonding interactions to generate 3D supramolecular networks. Complexes 1 and 2 have also been characterized by spectroscopic (IR and UV/Vis), thermal (TGA) and magnetic susceptibility measurements. In addition, both complexes exhibit antimicrobial activity.
keywords: Co II and Ni II complexes

i1JeBhQi.title: Synthesis and crystal structure of (PzCH2CHOHCH 2PzH)· (Ph2SnCl3) (Pz 5 3,5-dimethylpyrazol-1-yl)
i1JeBhQi.abstract: Reaction of Ph2SnCl2 with 1,3-bis(3,5- dimethylpyrazol- 1-yl)-2-propanol (L) in a 1:1 ratio yields L(SnPh 2Cl2)2 adduct, which partly hydrolyzes to the title complex (C25H31Cl3N4OSn, Mr = 628.58) during crystal growing in the air. The title complex is of monoclinic, space group P21/n with a = 9.0338(9), b = 17.890(1), c =17.340(1) Å , β = 95.533(1)°, V = 2798.9(5) Å 3, Z = 4, Dc = 1.492 Mg/m3, λ(MoKα) = 0.71073 Å , μ = 1.224 mm-1, F(000) = 1272, R = 0.023, wR = 0.054 for 4212 observed reflections with I ≥ 2σ(I). The crystal structure indicates that there is no direct interaction between the pyrazolyl ligand and the tin atom, but this complex forms a supramolecular structure through weak intermolecular C-H⋯Cl and O-H⋯Cl hydrogen bonds. © Springer Science+Business Media, LLC 2010.

Ehd9TWIQ.title: Direction of topological isomers of silver(I) coordination polymers induced by solvent, and selective anion-exchange of a class of PtS-type host frameworks.
Ehd9TWIQ.abstract: The construction of two types of coordination polymers with closely related 4-connected topologies [PtS and lvt (4(2).8(4))] were achieved based on a well-designed bent dipyrazine linker, and the topological differences only result from the stereochemistry of silver(I) coordination sphere with the same coordination donors. Selective anion-exchange functions of the series of PtS-type coordination networks containing different counter anions (from small BF4- to very large SbF6-) were identified.

C41LMrI8.title: {[Cu(bipy)2.5(H2O)](ClO4)2·(H2O)·(CH3OH)1.5}n (bipy=4,4′-bipyridine): organic template effect in formation of a novel bilayer coordination polymer with large chiral channels
C41LMrI8.abstract: In the presence of the organic template molecule, 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole, a unique acentric coordination polymer based on linear 4,4′-bipyridine (bipy) bridging ligand, {[Cu(bipy) 2.5 (H 2 O)](ClO 4 ) 2 · (H 2 O) · (CH 3 OH) 1.5 } n ( 1 ), was obtained by the reaction of Cu(II) perchlorate with bipy in H 2 O/CH 3 OH medium. The bidendate bipy molecules bridge the Cu II centers to form a 2-D bilayer framework with an 8 2 · 10 topology, and the monodendate bipy ligands, locating up and down each 2-D architecture, are involved in significant aromatic stacking interactions with the adjacent 2-D motifs, resulting in a 3-D porous network with large square channels for including the guest solvents and anions. Keywords Coordination polymer Porous material Aromatic stacking interactions Organic template Crystal structure The rapid expanding in crystal engineering of coordination polymers possessing polymeric metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) continues to produce various solid structures with novel compositions and topologies, along with potential applications as a new class of functional materials in host-guest chemistry, ion exchange, catalysis and for the development of optical, magnetic and electronic devices [1] . By appropriate choice of the bridging organic ligands (building blocks), such as the famous 4,4′-bipyridine (bipy), and coordination preferences of the metal ions, robust materials can be designed and assembled to generate zeolite-like molecular-sized channels, cavities and pores of various sizes and shapes [2] . It is well known that the assembly processes in formation of such coordination frameworks are affected by many factors such as anions and solvents [3] . For Cu II -bipy polymer systems, two isostructural 1-D chain coordination patterns [Cu(bipy)(H 2 O) 2 X 2 ] · (bipy), X = BF 4 - [4] or ClO 4 − [5] were reported, in which the uncoordinated bipy guest molecules are inserted in the cavities of the 2-D hydrogen-bonded layers formed by the inter-chain hydrogen bonds. Recently, we have reported an interesting 2-D grid-like Cu II -bipy coordination sheet, {[Cu(bipy) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ](ClO 4 ) 2 · (H 2 O) 3 · (bpo)} n exhibiting large square channels for the inclusion of the guest organic template 2,5-bis(3-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (bpo) [6] . In order to further understand the influence of the guest molecules in formation of the Cu II -bipy coordination polymers, we select an angular dipyridyl compound 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole [7] to extend this investigation, and an unexpected 2-D bilayer coordination polymer {[Cu(bipy) 2.5 (H 2 O)](ClO 4 ) 2 · (H 2 O) · (CH 3 OH) 1.5 } n ( 1 ) was obtained. Here we will report the structural analysis and interesting properties of this complex. To a solution of [Cu(H 2 O) 6 ](ClO 4 ) 2 (110 mg, 0.3 mmol) in H 2 O (20 ml) was slowly added a solution of bipy (80 mg, 0.5 mmol) in CH 3 OH (10 ml) with stirring for 30 min, then a solution of 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole (120 mg, 0.5 mmol) in hot CH 3 OH (30 ml) was added. The resulting mixture was stirred for 30 min under refluxing. The blue solution was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Blue block-shape single crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained within two weeks by slow evaporation of the solvent in 40% yield based on the bipy ligand [8] . Although 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole did not exist in the final product 1 , it clearly played a key role in formation of this 2-D bilayer framework, which is different to the reported 1-D [Cu(bipy)(H 2 O) 2 (ClO 4 ) 2 ] · (bipy) complex [5] that could be obtained from the same preparation procedure of 1 except that 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole is not involved in the starting material. Complex 1 is air stable and insoluble in common organic solvents and water, being consistent with its polymeric nature. In its IR spectrum, the broad band centered at ca. 3400 cm −1 accounts for O–H stretching of the solvents and the skeletal vibrations of the aromatic rings occur in 1400–1600 cm −1 region. The split ν Cl–O stretches of the perchlorate ions at ∼1100 cm −1 (another characteristic band is at 627 cm −1 ) provides good evidence of their involvement in the formation of hydrogen bonds. The TGA curve of polycrystalline sample 1 shows the first weight loss from 75 to 130 °C, corresponding to the removal of the H 2 O and CH 3 OH solvate molecules, and the loss of the coordinated aqua is not observed before 260 °C, beyond which the framework starts to collapse. The crystal structure determination of 1 [9] reveals that it is spontaneously resolved chiral crystal (each individual crystal is a single enantiomer), which is made up of a polymeric cationic [Cu(bipy) 2.5 (H 2 O)] 2+ framework containing large square channels that accommodate the ClO 4 − counter anions and solvate guest molecules. As shown in Fig. 1(a) , each Cu II center is in a slightly distorted square-planar geometry surrounded by four nitrogen donors from adjacent bipy ligands. The Cu–N bond distances vary form 1.980(7) to 2.018(6) Å, all being within the normal range observed for bipyridyl Cu II complexes [10] and the cis N–Cu–N angles around the metal center lie in 87.5(3)–92.7(3)°. Additionally, a weak coordination interaction between the Cu II center and the water O(9) is observed with the Cu–O distance of 2.445(6) Å. It is notable that two and half crystallographically independent bipy ligands exhibit different bidendate bridging and terminal monodendate coordination modes: type A ligands containing N(1)–N(2) group [two pyridyl rings are twisted by 52.3° with respect to each other] extend the Cu II centers to form two crystallographically related [Cu(bipy)] n linear chains in which the neighboring Cu⋯Cu distance is 11.00 Å; type B ligands possessing C 2 symmetry [with N(5) donor and the twisting angle of the pyridyl groups being 39.2°], acting as the pillars, further link these chains to result in the final bilayer architecture with the adjacent Cu⋯Cu separation bridged by it of 11.06 Å; type C bipy as a monodentate terminal ligand [two pyridyl rings are twisted by 29.1°] to binding to each Cu II center with N(3) donor [the shortest N(4)⋯Cu separation is 4.614 Å]. Fig. 1 (b) illustrates a schematic topology of 1 and how two [Cu(bipy)] n chains are cross-hatched. These chains are cross-linked by type B spacers which form the bottom portion of the T-shape moiety and the overall network can therefore be described and classified as a 2-D bilayer motif with the topological symbol of 8 2 · 10. Among the multifarious building units of the coordination polymers, the T-shape module is an attractive case due to many fascinating patterns were designed based on it, including 1-D ladder [11] , 2-D brick wall [12] , 2-D bilayer [13] and 3-D framework [14] , amongst which the bilayer motif is rare and has not been found until recent years [13,15] . A significant difference between 1 and other [M 2 (bipy) 3 (NO 3 )] 4 (M = Co II , Ni II and Zn II ) molecular bilayer polymers [13] resides in its 1:2.5 molar ratio of M:bipy. Coordination framework based on bipy with such a composition is really rare and only one case of [Ni(bipy) 2.5 (H 2 O) 2 ] was reported so far [16] , exhibiting a 1-D railroad pattern. The change of the M:bipy molar ratio introduces a monodentate bipy (type C) terminal to each Cu II center, which locates up and down the 2-D bilayer architecture. Analysis of the crystal packing of 1 showed that the 2-D cationic bilayers are further “connected” by π–π stacking interactions between these type C bipy molecules to form a 3-D open framework with large channels as shown in Fig. 2 . The distance between one edge of each pyridine ring and the neighboring inclined pyridyl plane is only 3.1 Å, indicating significant edge-to-face aromatic stacking interaction, which is one of the important types of non-covalent intermolecular forces similar to hydrogen bonding, and has been recognized to play a key role in the stabilization and regulatory function of the supramolecular construction [17] . However, it should be noted that the nature and utilization of π–π interaction, mainly for further prediction of the crystal packing, is still not well documented in contrast to the well-understood hydrogen-bonding interaction. Viewing along the crystallographic c direction, two types of large square channels (intra-bilayer A with the dimensions of ca. 8.5 × 8.5 Å 2 and interlayer B with the dimensions of ca. 8.5 × 7.0 Å 2 ) are observed. Computation of the channel space [18] revealed a value of 3912 Å 3 , corresponding to 51.3% of the unit-cell volume. Allowing for the volume of the included anions and solvate molecules, there still remains 1063 Å 3 (13.9%) of void space. After removal of the solvents, the empty space adds up to 2311 (30.3% of the unit cell). Additionally, the 3-D motif is further stabilized by O–H⋯O and C–H⋯O hydrogen bonding interactions between the host framework and the perchlorate anions/solvents in the channels. The structure of 1 contains large channels with included solvent molecules, indicating its porous nature. Kitagawa and coworkers [13a] have investigated the gas-adsorption function of the molecular bilayer materials [M 2 (bipy) 3 (NO 3 )] 4 (M = Co II , Ni II and Zn II ). Complex 1 is a chiral crystal (space group Aba2 with flack parameter of 0.03(3)) and the coordination framework of 1 has a higher thermal stable than such materials [13] , which may arise from the significant inter-layered aromatic stacking interactions in 1 . Thus, according to the structure and TGA results of 1 , we were intrigued by the possibility of generating a chiral microporous framework {[Cu(bipy) 2.5 (H 2 O)](ClO 4 ) 2 } n ( 1a ) by removing the guest molecules. XRPD pattern for this sample remains essentially identical to that of 1 , which clearly demonstrated that after removal of the included solvents, the porous chiral solid 1a was generated (the composition of this material was identified by elemental analysis and the loss weight of 1 ) that retain the framework integrity of the pristine solid 1 . Such a chiral material is quite rare and may have potential application [19] . In conclusion, a unique bilayer coordination polymer 1 with large channels and interesting porous properties has been prepared by means of direct self-assembly between Cu II and bipy building block in the presence of organic template molecule, and the results clearly suggest that the aromatic rings of bipy are potential interaction sites for inter-layered π–π stacking, which can be utilized to advantage in crystal engineering. Of further importance, combing this contribution and previous reports, we can conclude that the directly [5,6] or indirectly (this work) templating effect of the organic molecule could significantly tune the topologies and properties of such Cu(ClO 4 ) 2 /bipy coordination frameworks (1-D chain, 2-D sheet and 2-D bilayer, respectively). This may provide a helpful strategy to construction of other new such materials, which is undergoing in our lab. brB5EZot.title: Highly-thermostable metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) of zinc and cadmium 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)diphthalates with a unique fluorite topology.
brB5EZot.abstract: Two novel zinc and cadmium 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)diphthalate metal-organic frameworks have been synthesized and characterized using single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis, and exhibit a unique fluorite topology and high thermal stabilities.

fQVXlbGk.title: A novel 3D Mn(II) coordination polymer involving 4,4′-dipyridylsulfide and 4,4′-dipyridyltrisulfide obtained by in situ ligand formation from 4,4′-dipyridyldisulfide

0U0z09Cm.title: Significant positional isomeric effect on structural assemblies of Zn(II) and Cd(II) coordination polymers based on bromoisophthalic acids and various dipyridyl-type coligands
0U0z09Cm.abstract: Seven Zn(II) and Cd(II) coordination polymers, formulated as {[Zn 2(5-Br-ip)2(bpy)(H2O)]·2H 2O}n (1), {[Zn(5-Br-ip)(bpa)(H2O)]}n (2), {[Cd(5-Br-ip)(bpp)(H2O)]}n (3), {[Zn(5-Br-ip)(bpe)]} n (4), {[Zn2(4-Br-ip)2(bpy)] ·H 2O}n (5), {[Zn(4-Br-ip)(bpa)(H2O)]}n (6), and {[Cd(4-Br-ip)(bpp)]}n (7), were prepared by hydrothermal reactions based on 4-bromo- or 5-bromoisophthalic acid (4-Br-H2ip or 5-Br-H2ip) and different dipyridyl-type coligands 4,4′-bipyridyl (bpy), 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpa), 1,3-di(4-pyridyl) propane (bpp), and 1,2-di(4-pyridyl)ethene (bpe). All complexes 1-7 were characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectra, and X-ray single-crystal diffraction. Complex 1 is a 2D (6,3) coordination network and further assembled into a 3D framework via π-π stacking interactions. Complex 2 shows a 1D coordination array and further forms a 2D supramolecular network via H-bonding interactions. Complex 3 has a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D diamond framework. Complex 4 is a 3-fold interpenetrating 3D network with CdSO4 topology, constructed from alternately left- and right-handed helical arrays. Complex 5 has a 3D (3,4)-connected network with (4·82) (4·82·103) topology. Complex 6 features a 1D coordination chain and further forms a 2D helical supramolecular pattern by H-bonding. Complex 7 exhibits a (3,5)-connected 2D layer with the Schläfli symbol of (42·6) (42·67·8) . The results reveal that the diverse coordination networks of 1-7 can be adjusted by the different dispositions of the -Br substituent of isophthalate building blocks, as well as the metal ions and the dipyridyl coligands. Moreover, the luminescent properties of the complexes have been investigated. © 2010 American Chemical Society.

Fd7f9YqB.title: Copper and cadmium coordination polymers of di-3-pyridinylmethanone: Subtle anion effect on the dimensionality of Cd(II) frameworks
Fd7f9YqB.abstract: Syntheses and characterization of two pairs of Cu(II) and Cd(II) coordination polymers with di-3-pyridinylmethanone revealed that variation the counter anion from ClO 4 - to BF 4 - does not change the structures of Cu(II) complexes, but it lowers the dimensionality of the Cd(II) framework.

yhSWZrcE.title: Co5/Co8-cluster-based coordination polymers showing high-connected self-penetrating networks: syntheses, crystal structures, and magnetic properties.
yhSWZrcE.abstract: Two novel Co(II)-cluster-based coordination polymers--namely, [Co5(μ3-OH)2(1,4-ndc)4(bix)2]n (1) and {[Co8(μ3-OH)4(1,4-ndc)6(btp)(H2O)6]·H2O}n (2)--were prepared by hydrothermal reactions of Co(II) perchlorate with 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid (1,4-H2ndc) and different N-donor coligands (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene and btp = 4,4'-bis(triazol-1-ylmethyl)biphenyl). In 1, 10-connected [Co5(μ3-OH)2(COO)8] clusters are extended by the μ4-1,4-ndc(2-) and trans-bix ligands to construct a rare, self-penetrating ile framework that can interestingly be regarded as the cross-link of two interpenetrating 6-connected pcu networks. While for 2, [Co8(μ3-OH)4(COO)12] clusters serve as the 8-connected nodes, which are bridged by the μ4/μ5-1,4-ndc(2-) and trans-btp ligands to afford the highest-connected uninodal self-penetrating (4(20).6(8)) network based on octacobalt clusters. A synthetic and structural comparison of 1 and 2 demonstrates that the features of auxiliary N-donor ligands play a key role in governing the in situ formed clusters and the final 3-D coordination frameworks. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that complex 1 shows an antiferromagnetic interaction between the adjacent Co(II) ions, whereas 2 displays the dominant antiferromagnetic exchanges in 300-50 K and a ferrimagnetic-like behavior at lower temperatures.

vzXFf19b.title: Synthesis, characterization and crystal structures of new MnII, FeII and AgI complexes with an angular dipyridyl ligand 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole
vzXFf19b.abstract: Three new metal–organic supramolecular complexes based on the linking unit 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L) and inorganic Mn II , Fe II , Ag I salts have been prepared and structurally determined by single-crystal X-ray analysis. Using L to react with Mn(ClO 4 ) 2 ·6H 2 O yielded a mononuclear molecule, [Mn(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ](ClO 4 ) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ( 1 ) (triclinic, P −1, a =8.790(4) Å, b =10.227(4) Å, c =23.255(10) Å, α =89.371(8)°, β =82.980(8)°, γ =88.621(8)°, Z =2), in which the hydrogen bonding and π–π aromatic stacking interactions extend the complex molecules to result in a two-dimensional (2D) supramolecular network. Reaction of L and FeCl 2 ·4H 2 O, in the presence of NH 4 SCN, afforded another mononuclear complex, [Fe(L) 2 (NSC) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ] ( 2 ) (triclinic, P −1, a =7.985(3) Å, b =8.657(3) Å, c =11.334(4) Å, α =94.243(6)°, β =109.989(7)°, γ =94.413(7)°, Z =1). A 3D framework is observed through hydrogen bonds and π–π stacking co-affections between the complex molecules. Additionally, a 1D coordination polymer, [Ag 2 (L) 2 ](BF 4 ) 2 (CH 3 OH) 0.5 (H 2 O) 0.5 ( 3 ) (triclinic, P −1, a =8.321(3) Å, b =13.926(5) Å, c =14.229(5) Å, α =70.801(7)°, β =77.216(7)°, γ =81.299(7)°, Z =2) was obtained when AgBF 4 was used in the above reaction. The structure of 3 contains significant aromatic interactions, which bind the infinite chains together to form a 2D layer network. Keywords Crystal structures Hydrogen bond π–π Stacking interaction Coordination polymer Supramolecular network 1 Introduction Self-assembly processes involving metal ions and organic ligands have attracted ever-increasing attention in the area of supramolecular chemistry and crystal engineering from the viewpoints of the development of novel functional materials with desired properties [1–5] . One of the ultimate goals of supramolecular chemistry is to predictably control the network structure, and thus to further modify the physicochemical property of the target product. The selection of proper ligands as ‘building blocks’, such as the simple 4,4′-bipyridyl-based ligands, is undoubtedly a key point in manipulating the network structures [6] , and other factors such as the selection of the metal ion, the counter-anion and solvent effect have also been systematically studied by chemists in the past decade [7] . A novel angular dipyridyl-donor ligand, 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L) ( Chart 1 ), and its 3- N -donor analog 2,5-bis(3-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L′), have been of our research interest [8–17] for their particular characteristics described as following. (a) These ligands can take versatile bonding modes, such as monodentate (using one pyridyl nitrogen donor), bidentate bridging (using two pyridyl nitrogen donors), and tridentate bridging (using two pyridyl and one oxadiazole nitrogen donors) coordination modes to construct diverse coordination frameworks. (b) The structural geometries of the ligands themselves are changeful. The dihedral angles between the oxadiazole ring and two pyridyl rings, as well as the angle between the center of the oxadiazole ring and two pyridyl nitrogen donors, are adaptable to meet the coordination requirements. (c) The aromatic groups in each ligand, including two pyridyl rings and the central oxadiazole system, usually show a tendency to completely or partly participate in intermolecular π–π interactions, which may significantly affect the packing arrangements of the structures. As a continuation of our work, we describe the preparation and structural characterization of three new complexes based on 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L), [Mn(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ](ClO 4 ) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ( 1 ), [Fe(L) 2 (NSC) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ] ( 2 ) and [Ag 2 (L) 2 ](BF 4 ) 2 (CH 3 OH) 0.5 (H 2 O) 0.5 ( 3 ), in the present contribution. The non-covalent intermolecular contacts, such as π–π stacking interactions and/or hydrogen bonds, are presented in these complexes, and their effects on the overall supramolecular architectures are discussed in detail. 2 Experimental 2.1 Materials and general methods With the exception of the bridging ligand 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L), which was synthesized according to reported literature procedure [18] , all of the starting materials and solvents were obtained commercially and used as received. Fourier transform (FT)-IR spectra (KBr pellets) were taken on a FT-IR 170SX (Nicolet) spectrometer. Carbon, hydrogen, and nitrogen analyses were performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240C analyzer. 2.2 Synthesis of complexes 1 – 3 [Mn(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ](ClO 4 ) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ( 1 ). A solution of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH 3 CN (15 ml) was added to an aqueous solution (10 ml) of Mn(ClO 4 ) 2 ·6H 2 O (36 mg, 0.1 mmol). After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing, the solution was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Light-yellow prismatic single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by evaporation of the solvent within 1 week. Yield: 65%. Found: C, 42.4; H, 3.8; N, 18.3%. Calc. for C 32 H 32 Cl 2 MnN 12 O 12 : C, 42.6; H, 3.6; N, 18.6%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm −1 ): 3455b, 3067s, 2220m, 1662m, 1616m, 1570m, 1489m, 1423s, 1283m, 1219m, 1108vs, 1063s, 1008m, 842m, 723s, 626m, 504m. [Fe(L) 2 (NSC) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ] ( 2 ). A solution of an excess of NH 4 SCN (24 mg, 0.3 mmol) in H 2 O (10 ml) was added to a CH 3 CN/CHCl 3 solution (15 ml) containing FeCl 2 ·4H 2 O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol) and L (44 mg, 0.2 mmol) in 1:2 molar ratio. After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing under refluxing, the reaction mixture was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Yellow block single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent within 2 weeks. Yield: 70%. Found: C, 47.9; H, 3.2; N, 20.9%. Calc. for C 26 H 20 FeN 10 O 4 S 2 : C, 47.6; H, 3.1; N, 21.3%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm −1 ): 3355b, 3088w, 3038w, 2077vs, 1955w, 1613s, 1566s, 1541s, 1486s, 1422s, 1370w, 1335m, 1322w, 1275m, 1230w, 1218s, 1124m, 1107w, 1064s, 1006s, 966m, 840s, 744s, 723vs, 710s, 695s. [Ag 2 (L) 2 ](BF 4 ) 2 (CH 3 OH) 0.5 (H 2 O) 0.5 ( 3 ). A solution of AgBF 4 (19 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH 3 OH (10 ml) was carefully layered on top of a CHCl 3 solution (10 ml) of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in a test-tube. After ca. 2 weeks at room temperature, colorless single crystals appeared at the boundary between CH 3 OH and CHCl 3 . Yield: 50%. Found: C, 33.7; H, 2.6; N, 13.3%. Calc. for C 24.5 H 19 Ag 2 B 2 F 8 N 8 O 3 : C, 34.1; H, 2.2; N, 13.0%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm −1 ): 3440b, 3104m, 3062w, 1619s, 1567s, 1542s, 1488s, 1429s, 1341w, 1285m, 1224m, 1073vs, 1022vs, 971m, 845s, 747s, 731s, 716s, 705m, 551w, 521m, 506w, 411w. 2.3 Crystallographic data collection and structure determination Single-crystal X-ray diffraction study of complexes 1 – 3 were performed on a BRUKER SMART 1000 CCD diffractometer equipped with a graphite crystal monochromator situated in the incident beam. The data collections were performed with Mo Kα radiation ( λ =0.71073 Å) by ϖ scan mode in the range of 2.17< θ <25.03° (for 1 ), 2.73< θ <25.02° (for 2 ) and 2.70< θ <25.03° (for 3 ) at 293(2) K. All data were corrected by semi-empirical method using sadabs program. The program saint [19] was used for integration of the diffraction profiles. All structures were solved by direct methods using shelxs program of the shelxtl -97 package and refined with shelxl [20] . Metal atoms in all complexes were located from the E -maps and other non-hydrogen atoms were located in successive difference Fourier syntheses. The final refinements were performed by full matrix least-squares methods with anisotropic thermal parameters for non-hydrogen atoms on F 2 . The hydrogen atoms of the ligand were placed in the calculated sites and included in the final refinement in the riding model approximation with displacement parameters derived from the parent atoms to which they were bonded. The ratios of minimum to maximum apparent transmission are 0.9069 (for 1 ), 0.9358 (for 2 ), and 0.8830 (for 3 ), respectively. Molecular graphics were drawn with the program package XP. Further crystallographic data and experimental details for structural analyses of complexes 1 – 3 are summarized in Table 1 , and selected bond lengths and angles with their estimated standard deviations in Table 2 , respectively. 3 Results and discussion 3.1 Synthesis and general characterization of complexes 1 – 3 Ligand L is very soluble in common polar organic solvents (such as CH 2 Cl 2 , CHCl 3 , CH 3 OH and CH 3 CN etc.), so that crystallization of its complexes with inorganic metal salts occurs readily. As stated above, single crystals of complexes 1 and 2 were prepared by the reactions of corresponding metal salt and L in 1:2 molar ratio through slow evaporation of the solvent. Additionally, the final product for 2 was independent to the quantity of NH 4 SCN. Complex 3 was obtained as crystalline polymeric compound in CH 3 OH/CHCl 3 mixed solvent system by combination of L with AgBF 4 in 1:1 molar ratio through diffusion. Compounds 1 – 3 are air stable and can retain their structural integrity at room temperature for a considerable length of time. The IR spectra of complexes 1 – 3 show absorption bands resulting from the skeletal vibration of the aromatic rings in the 1400–1600 cm −1 region. A strong and broad band centered around 3455 (for 1 ) and 3355 (for 2 ) cm −1 can be assignable to the ν O–H stretch of the coordinated water molecules, and that around 3440 (for 3 ) to the ν O–H stretch of the lattice aqua or CH 3 OH solvents. The characteristic absorption band with medium intensity of CH 3 CN ( ν CN ) in 1 appears at 2220 cm −1 . Additionally, the IR spectrum for 2 displays the very strong absorption band of the NCS − anions at 2077 cm −1 . 3.2 Description of the crystal structures of complexes 1 – 3 [Mn(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ](ClO 4 ) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ( 1 ). Complex 1 consists of a discrete centrosymmetrical [Mn(L) 2 (H 2 O) 2 (CH 3 CN) 2 ] 2+ , two ClO 4 − anions, and two lattice CH 3 CN molecules. The crystal structure of the cationic mononuclear unit is depicted in Fig. 1a . The Mn II ion is located at a crystallographic inversion center, and six-coordinated to two aqua and two CH 3 CN molecules in the equatorial plane, as well as two L ligands in the axial positions. The coordination geometry of the metal center can be described as a slightly distorted octahedron with the cis N–Mn–N and N–Mn–O angles being in the range of 87.48(15)–92.52(15)°. The two pyridine rings within each ligand form the dihedral angles of 3.1 and 1.3°, respectively, with the central oxadiazole plane, and the dihedral angle of 2.5° with each other. In addition, it should be noted that two similar, but crystallographically independent molecules were observed in this structure. They have similar mononuclear motifs with only slight difference in bond distances and angles ( Table 2 ). Herein the L ligand uses only one of the pyridyl nitrogen atoms to bind to the metal center. The other uncoordinated pyridyl nitrogen serves as the hydrogen-bonding acceptor of the coordinated aqua molecule of another mononuclear cation with the O⋯N distance of 2.731 Å [21] . Such hydrogen bonds extend the mononuclear units to 1D chains with loop-like links ( Fig. 1b ). There also exist intra-chain aromatic stacking interaction between the coordinated pyridyl ring and the adjacent uncoordinated case in each loop, with the inter-planar separation of 3.415 Å (center-to-center separation=3.722 Å) [22] . Furthermore, these 1D chains are stacked parallel to generate a 2D undulating sheet along ac plane through the inter-chain aromatic interaction between the oxadiazole ring and the coordinated pyridyl ring. The inter-planar and center-to-center separations here are 3.302 and 3.655 Å, respectively. Therefore, in complex 1 , the hydrogen bond and π–π stacking interactions play an influential role in expanding the mononuclear units to 2D layers, among which lie the disordered ClO 4 − anions and lattice CH 3 CN molecules. Using L to react with Cu(ClO 4 ) 2 ·6H 2 O in a CH 3 OH/H 2 O medium (even if in CH 3 CN/H 2 O system just as the preparation procedure of 1 ), a two-fold interpenetrated diamondoid 3D framework was afforded [8] , whose extended structure contrasts greatly with that of 1 . This discrepancy suggests that the nature of the metal ions highly influences the structural topologies of such coordination frameworks. [Fe(L) 2 (NSC) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ] ( 2 ). The molecular structure of the neutral mononuclear compound 2 is depicted in Fig. 2a . The coordination environment of Fe II ion is similar to that of Mn II in 1 . Each metal center is in an elongated octahedral environment composed of two nitrogen atoms from two NSC − groups (Fe–N NCS =2.139(3) Å) and two aqua oxygen atoms (Fe–O=2.208(2) Å) in the equatorial plane, and two nitrogen atoms from two L ligands (Fe–N py =2.353(2) Å) in the axial positions. The cis N–Fe–N and N–Fe–O angles are in the range of 89.38(10)–90.62(10)° as listed in Table 2 . The NSC − anions are coordinated to Fe II in a monodentate terminal mode with the angles of 166.2(3)° for Fe(1)–N(5)–C(13) and 178.7(3)° for N(5)–C(13)–S(1). Two pyridyl rings within each L molecule deviate by 3.3° from co-planarity, and form the dihedral angles of 3.7 and 1.2°, respectively, with the central oxadiazole plane. In 2 , a pair of centrosymmetrically related L ligands coordinate to the Fe II center in monodentate fashion to form the basal mononuclear unit. The uncoordinated pyridine and oxadiazole rings participate in the hydrogen bonds with the coordinated aqua molecules, which bind the mononuclear molecules to form a 2D layer structure. The O(2)⋯N(2) and O(2)⋯N(4) separations are 2.901 and 2.795 Å, respectively, and the corresponding O(2)–H(1)⋯N(2) and O(2)–H(2)⋯N(4) angles are 159.5 and 159.6°. Moreover, the pyridyl rings of the ligands are involved in the interlayer face-to-face aromatic stacking interactions with the closest separation of 3.452 Å (center-to-center distance=3.690 Å), through which the 2D layers are stacked parallel along a direction to generate a 3D supramolecular structure ( Fig. 2b ). It is noteworthy that complex 2 is the first Fe II coordination compound based on the series of angular dipyridyl-donor ligands. We have prepared three analogous complexes, [M(L) 2 (NSC) 2 (H 2 O) 2 ] (M=Cd II , Mn II or Co II ), in the same synthetic method [10,11] . These results indicate such mononuclear structure is thermodynamically stable and independent to the variety of the metal ions. [Ag 2 (L) 2 ](BF 4 ) 2 (CH 3 OH) 0.5 (H 2 O) 0.5 ( 3 ). The structure of 3 consists of 1D cationic chains, BF 4 − anions, CH 3 OH and aqua molecules. There are two independent Ag I centers [Ag(1) and Ag(2)] bridged by the L ligand in the asymmetric unit ( Fig. 3a ) . Each Ag I center is in a linear coordination environment (N–Ag(1)–N=175.3(4), N–Ag(2)–N=171.8(4)°) and coordinates to two pyridyl N atoms (Ag(1)–N: 2.127(9) and 2.151(9) Å; Ag(2)–N: 2.130(9) and 2.164(9) Å) from distinct bridging ligands. The L ligand links two Ag I centers in bidentate bridging mode with two pyridyl N donors to form an infinite chain. Two L molecules around the metal center are different in structural geometry. Two pyridine rings within one L form the dihedral angles of 6.1 and 21.4°, respectively, with the oxadiazole plane, and the dihedral angle of 25.7° with each other. The corresponding values for the other L molecule are 5.7, 8.2 and 13.6°, respectively. The angle between the central oxadiazole ring and two N donors of the 4-pyridyl rings in each L molecule is 138.8 or 139.7°, resulting in a sinusoidal chain motif. The separation of the ligand-bridging Ag⋯Ag contact is 13.936 Å. Of further interest, these infinite chains are arranged in a parallel fashion and form an undulating layer ( Fig. 3b ). The neighboring chains are anti-parallel to each other with the nearest inter-chain Ag⋯Ag distance of 3.879 Å. One of the two pyridyl rings around each Ag(1) or Ag(2) center is involved in the π–π stacking interaction with one oxadiazole ring in the other anti-parallel chain (inter-planar separation=3.042/3.318 Å, center-to-center separation=3.706/3.657 Å). These aromatic interactions extend the 1D chains to result in a 2D supramolecular layer, which are further stacked in an offset fashion with ABAB sequence. The BF 4 − anions and solvent guest molecules are incorporated in the interlayer regions. Although it has been well known that hydrogen bonding interactions are usually effective in extending the dimensions of a supramolecular network, however, the organic ligands involved in the nucleation process use both coordination and π–π stacking interactions to build up the supramolecular framework, is still not well documented. In the structures of complexes 1 – 3 , the significant aromatic staking interactions do play a critical role in expanding the dimensionality of the frameworks. 4 Conclusion Three metal complexes 1 – 3 have been prepared by means of self-assemblies of Mn II , Fe II , Ag I salts and 2,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,4-oxadiazole (L), and structurally characterized by X-ray diffraction analyses. The resultant structures of these complexes are profoundly influenced by π–π stacking interactions and/or hydrogen bonds, which will provide interesting examples for supramolecular chemistry and crystal engineering. 5 Supplementary materials Crystallographic data for the crystal structures reported in this paper have been deposited with the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Center (CCDC Nos. 228104/05/06). This material can be obtained free of charge via http://www.ccdc.cam.ac.uk/conts/retrieving.html (or from the CCDC, 12 Union Road, Cambridge CB2 1EZ, UK; fax:+44-1223-336033; e-mail: deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk). Acknowledgements This work was financially supported by the Natural Science Foundation of Tianjin (No. 033609711) and the Starting Funding of Tianjin Normal University (to M. Du). zQdjz6Dv.title: Novel (4,8)-connected scu coordination framework constructed by tetrakis(4-benzoic acid)ethylene
zQdjz6Dv.abstract: A novel (4,8)-connected scu {[Co(tbe)0.5(H2O) 2]·0.5H2O} framework has been built by using a predesigned octahedral node of tetrakis(4-benzoic acid)ethylene. The magneto-structural relation study indicates weak anti-ferromagnetic coupling between metal ions transmitted by syn-anti carboxylate pathway due to the non-planarity of the Co-O-C-O-Co unit. 8Sp6kT1R.title: Two 3D open coordination frameworks constructed by CdII or ZnII perchlorate and 4-(4-pyridyl)-3,5-bis(2-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole showing selective anion-exchange behaviors to acetate
8Sp6kT1R.abstract: Two isostructural 3D coordination polymers (CPs) {[M(L242) 2](ClO4)2}n (MII = CdII for 1 and ZnII for 2) have been constructed from metal perchlorates and a tripyridyltriazole ligand 4-(4-pyridyl)-3,5-bis(2-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole (L242). The host framework of each CP comprises two interpenetrating lvt topological networks. Three types of 1D channels with different chirality (achirality and left-handed or right-handed helicity) are observed to hold the perchlorate guest anions. Interestingly, both CPs materials have the exclusive and irreversible anion-exchange behaviors for acetate (OAc-), which however, are unavailable to chloride (Cl-), fluoroborate (BF 4 -), or nitrate (NO3 -) anion. CPs 1 and 2 also show ligand-based solid-state fluorescent emissions at room temperature. © 2013 Elsevier B.V.

aMkFoVew.title: Norfloxacin salts with benzenedicarboxylic acids: Charge-assisted hydrogen-bonding recognition and solubility regulation
aMkFoVew.abstract: The crystallization of norfloxacin, an antibacterial fluoroquinolone compound, with different benzenedicarboxylic acids yields five novel pharmaceutical salts via molecular recognition. X-ray single-crystal diffraction analyses reveal that these pharmaceutical agents present uniform charge-assistant hydrogen-bonding networks, which are in 1:1 stoichiometry of norfloxacin and dicarboxylate therein (with the exception of that with terephthalate). Unsubstituted benzenedicarboxylates (phthalate in 1, isophthalate in 2, and terephthalate in 3, respectively) are likely to crystallize with norfloxacin without lattice solvents, while the substituted isophthalate moieties (2-aminoisophthalate in 4 and 5-aminoisophthalate in 5) tend to form supramolecular adducts with the inclusion of water. Aromatic stacking interactions are present in all these structures, occurring between the fluoroquinolone and carboxylate phenyl rings (in 1-4) as well as between the fluoroquinolone planes (in 5). Thermal stability and solubility of all crystalline binary adducts have been determined. The effect of carboxylate counterions, substituents, and hydration states on the solubility and dissolution profile of drug salts 1-5 are investigated in pure water and 0.1 M HCl. After the formation of salts, the solubility increases at near neutral pH in almost all cases (except 3), but the order is changed in acidic medium. Phthalic acid shows evidence of a good candidate to enhance the solubility of fluoroquinolone drugs for the solubility of 1 is approximately 39 times as large as that of norfloxacin in pure water and also larger than that of norfloxacin in acidic system. For the isophthalates series, 2 has very poor solubility in 0.1 M HCl (only 0.06 times as that of Nf), while amino substituted isophthalates result in the enhancement of the solubility. Remarkably, crystal packing analyses of these pharmaceutical salts allow a possible correlation between the H-bonding prototypes and the solubility to be established. © 2013 The Royal Society of Chemistry.

eCG5CgDb.title: Kinetics and Mechanism Study of the Catalytic Carboxyester Hydrolysis Using Co~Ⅱ Nitrate with a Tripod Ligand 1,3,5-Tri-(N-α-Pyridylmethylenic Aminomethylenic)Benzene
eCG5CgDb.abstract: The Co~Ⅱ complex with a tripod ligand(L) has been examined as a catalyst for the hydrolysis of 4-nitrophenyl acetate(NA) ester,which was investigated kinetically by observing the rates of the release of p-nitrophenol in the buffers at 25 ℃ and different pH values.The ligand forms a 1∶3(L∶Co) complex in the pH range of 7.5-9.4.The kinetic studies have been performed using the cobalt complex in 10%(V/V) CH_3CN-H_2O at 25 ℃,I=0.10 mol·dm~(-3) KNO_3 and pH 7.5-9.4.The results show that the Co~Ⅱ complex serves as a good nucleophile that effectively catalyzes NA hydrolysis.The hydrolysis rate follows the law v=(k~(ML)_(obs)+k_(OH)+k_0) .The second order hydrolysis rate constant using Co_3LH_(-1) is 0.197 mol~(-1)·dm~3·s~(-1).

ZtyjRqz4.title: 1,4-Bis(carboxymethyldiphenylphosphonio)butane dibromide, (CH 2)4[(HOOCCH2)Ph2P (+)]2·2Br(-)
ZtyjRqz4.abstract: The centrosymmetric cation {[(HOOCCH2PPh2)] 2(CH2)4}2+ adopts an extended conformation. The phosphorus atom shows a tetrahedral coordination and each O-H of the carboxylic group is hydrogen bonded to a bromide ion. Copyright © 2004 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.

rByWJNPU.title: Controlling the framework formation of silver(I) coordination polymers with 1,4-bis(phenylthio)butane by varying the solvents, metal-to-ligand ratio, and counteranions.
rByWJNPU.abstract: The reactions of 1,4-bis(phenylthio)butane (L) with Ag(I) salts in varied conditions (varying the solvents, metal-to-ligand ratios, and counteranions) lead to the formation of four new two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymers with different network structures: [Ag(2)L(3)(ClO(4))(2)](infinity) 1, [Ag(2)L(3)(ClO(4))(2) x CH(3)OH](infinity) 2, [[AgL(2)](ClO(4))](infinity) 3, and [AgLNO(3)](infinity) 4. All the structures were established by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. Crystal data for 1: triclinic, P-1, a = 11.0253(9) A, b = 11.3455(9) A, c = 11.5231(9) A, alpha = 93.931(2) degrees, beta = 92.689(2) degrees, gamma = 112.9810(10) degrees, Z = 2. 2: triclinic, P-1, a = 11.9147(13) A, b = 16.1534(17) A, c = 16.2259(17) A, alpha = 74.977(2) degrees, beta = 69.030(2) degrees, gamma = 69.986(2) degrees, Z = 2. 3: triclinic, P-1, a = 12.1617(9) A, b = 12.5054(10) A, c = 13.1547(10) A, alpha = 64.3370(10) degrees, beta =85.938 (2) degrees, gamma = 69.3010(10) degrees, Z = 2. 4: monoclinic, P2(1)/c, a = 5.4032(17) A, b = 16.974(6) A, c = 19.489(6) A, beta = 94.234(6) degrees, Z = 4. In all four complexes, each Ag(I) center has a tetracoordination geometry, and the 2D networks consist of fused large macrometallacyclic ring systems. The "hexagonal" 42-membered rings, Ag(6)L(6), observed in 1 and 2 are nearly identical, which could be considered as unique examples of self-sustaining noninterpenetrated frameworks formed with flexible ligands. The repeating rectangular 28-membered macrometallacycle, Ag(4)L(4), is the basis for the network of 3, in which the perchlorate anions occupy the voids to prevent the ring from collapsing. In 4, columns of the fused rectangular 22-membered rings, Ag(4)L(2)(NO(3))(2), are cross-linked through the L ligands to form a unique 2D network consisting of two types of 22-membered repeating units.

O8Wz3Tc8.title: Solvent-regulated assemblies of silver(I) and cadmium(II) supramolecular complexes with versatile tripyridyltriazole multidentate ligands
O8Wz3Tc8.abstract: This work presents two pairs of Ag(I) and Cd(II) supramolecular complexes assembled based on two versatile tripyridyltriazole ligands 3,5-bis(2-pyridyl)- 4-(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole (L242) and 3-(2-pyridyl)- 4,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole (L244), respectively. All four complexes have been prepared under similar conditions and characterized by elemental analysis, IR, and powder X-ray diffraction techniques. Singlecrystal X-ray diffraction indicates that these complexes display the infinite 1-D and 2-D arrays for {[Ag(L242)(CF3COO)](CH3OH)} n (1) and {[Ag2(L242)(CF3COO) 2](CH3CN)0.75(H2O) 0.25}n (2) as well as discrete dinuclear and tetranuclear coordination patterns for [Cd(L244)I2]2 (3) and [Cd2(L244)2I4(DMF) 2]2(DMF)2 (4). In 1 and 3, extended supramolecular architectures are further constructed via aromatic stacking interactions. Structural difference for each pair of complexes can be properly assigned to the significant solvent effect on assembled reactions (CH 3OH-H2O vs. CHCl3-CH3CN for 1 and 2 as well as CH3OH-H2O vs. H2O-DMF for 3 and 4). Thermal stability and fluorescence of these complexes have also been investigated. © 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

DSPDGKY1.title: Solvent-induced conformational isomerism of a flexible fluorinated bis(imidazole) ligand on the self-assembly of 1-D and 2-D CuII coordination polymers
DSPDGKY1.abstract: Two distinct coordination polymers [Cu(Fbix)2(NO 3)2]n (1) and {[Cu(Fbix)2(NO 3)2]•6H2O}n (2) have been prepared from the reactions of CuII nitrate with a flexible fluorinated ligand 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoro-1,4-bis(imidazol-1-yl-methyl)benzene (Fbix) under different solvents. Single crystal X-ray diffraction reveals that 1 displays a 1-D double-chain structure containing the Fbix with gauche conformation whereas 2 has a 2-D rhombic grid network containing the Fbix with anti conformation. Their spectroscopic, thermal, and fluorescence properties have also been investigated. © 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

XfBAISTW.title: First tetrameric NiII cluster with planar triangular topology exhibiting ferromagnetic pathways.
XfBAISTW.abstract: [Ni4L3(H2O)2](ClO4)2.2H2O 1, the first tetranuclear NiII cluster showing triangle planar geometry, formed with a new carboxylic-functionalized 1,5-diazacyclooctane bridging ligand has been presented; the global magnetic coupling is ferromagnetic and anisotropic calculations have been made.
